Description: Pottery bowl containing pink coloured paint (the plant dye madder mixed with gypsum), once belonging to a fresco painter.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Bibliographic references: Old Catalogue / A Catalogue of the Greek and Etruscan Vases in the British Museum (278)
Cartwright and Middleton 2008 / Scientific aspects of ancient faces: mummy portraits from Egypt (p.60, fig.2, p.63, table.5)
Daniels et al 2014 / Technological insights into madder pigment production in antiquity (p.18, table.1)
